div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1746 Sarnakunk environs, Sisian raion, c. 150 km. SE of Erevan, Armenia, 1945 Burial: 30-25 B.C. (Pakhomov) Contents: 178+ AR. Pot hoard Mithradates VI, Pontus: 1 tetradr. Pergamum: 4 cist. Ariarathes IX: 1 dr. Ariobarzanes I: 2 dr. Tigranes I, Armenia: 1 tetradr., 1 dr. (An- tiocheia ?) Artavasdes III: 1 dr. Alexander I Bala: 1 tetradr. Antiochus VII: 9 tetradr. Demetrius II: 3 tetradr. Philip Philadelphus: 17 tetradr. Anthony-Cleopatra: 4 tetradr. (Antiocheia) Aradus: 1 tetradr. Sidon: 1 tetradr. Tyre: 24 tetradr. Mithradates II, Parthia: 1 dr. Phraates III?: 1 dr. Orodes II: 6 dr. Roman Rep.: 4 cist., 95 den. (to 34 B.C.) Disposition: Erevan â€ Shakhnazar'ian, Trudy Gosudarstvennogo Istori- cheskogo Muzeia Akademii Nauk Armianskoi SSR 2 (Erevan, 1950), pp. 7-35 (in Ar- menian) Pakhomov VI, no. 1530 Kropotkin, no. 1558 Crawford, RRCH, no. 455 The coins are described according to Pakho- mov
